title: what is the difference beteen "blind" and "disarm"
body:
other than {{item:3222}}  can remove "disarm" but not blind, and disarm can stop {{champion:236}}  ulti

like they literally do the exact same thing..

i hardly see that as a reason to code a whole different form of CC.. what am i missing?

replies.body:
With a blind, you can still declare the attack, and with a disarm, you can't.

If {{champion:32}}, {{champion:117}}, or {{champion:39}} (via his R, her W, or her R, respectively) disarms a target with an empowered auto like {{champion:75}}'s Siphoning Strike or {{champion:67}}'s Tumble, they cannot trigger the empowered attack at all, but keep the attack's buff and are allowed to trigger it when the disarm ends.

However, if {{champion:17}} blinds either of these champions, they _can_ trigger the empowered attack which will consume it, losing the buff that grants the empowered auto. However, because of the blind, the empowered attack does no damage and does not apply any secondary effects.

So Lets put both into real life.

If In a gunfight, a bird takes my eyes out, i can still fire, except at random locations.

if in the same situation, my gun gets taken, I can't fire.
